name: La Fonda Barranco

reviews.text: We have just returned from a fabulous weekend at La Fonda Barranco. The property is beautiful, so calm and serene and very tastefully decorated. We had quite a large party so booked all eight rooms in the hotel. It was the most relaxing weekend I have ever had !
reviews.title: Fabulous Weekend in Jerez

likes.liked: — The beds and the groovy showers with no plugholes

reviews.text: David the owner is the perfect host - nothing is too much trouble. We all went out fairly late at night and on our return we found a chilled bottle of mineral water outside our bedroom door. He even took my friend to the lighting shop in downtown Jerez, because she admired his wall lights and said she would like to buy ones the same. Now thats what I call service!
reviews.title: Style, Relaxation and Excellent Service at La Fonda Barranco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: He recommended the beach at Rota, which is lovely. Very chilled out and family oriented and the sea is warm and great to swim in. He also booked us a session at the local arab baths, which again were fab. If you like drinking, eating, sleeping, swimming, chilling and good fun. Then this is the hotel and the city for you. The only disappointment, was having to go home at the end of it.
reviews.title: Lovely time, lovely place ...

likes.liked: — The location and the helpful owner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were originally introduced to La Fonda Barranco through the recommendations on Trip Advisor and now it is our pleasure to add our piece to the already positive reviews there.
reviews.title: A haven of peace in Jerez

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at La Fonda Barranco for 2 nights in September. Leading up to our stay I e-mailed David a couple of times and he was always very helpful and prompt in responding. The hotel itself in a great location - but do download the directions from their website if you are driving there yourself because Jerez is not the easiest town to navigate around!
reviews.title: Fantastic hosts!

reviews.text: David and Fiona were great hosts. They recommended lots to do and see during our short stay in Jerez. As a result of their recommendations we went to a very small, traditional bodega (where David and Fiona joined us for the tasting session!), a traditional flamenco show, the Arab baths and lots of small bars and restaurants that David recommended.
reviews.title: What a welcoming hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was small but very clean and well equipped. The one down side to the room was that it overlooked the road outside and when traffic passed in the night it was very noisy! However, we always carry ear plugs when we travel and these blocked out the noise.
reviews.title: It's true! La Fonda B is great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would have no doubt recommending this hotel to friends and family and hope to return one day ourselves. Jerez is a fantastic town and well worth a visit. It was my favourite stop on a two week tour of Andalucia.
reviews.title: Tip top place

reviews.text: We stayed in an apartment here at the end of September on the recommendation of friends. We made the booking after reading the comments on Trip Advisor and can confirm that all the positive comments one can read are indeed correct!
reviews.title: The best service in a hotel ever experienced

likes.liked: — Charming old property in the centre of town and great service

reviews.text: Our family spent a week at La Fonda Barranco recently. David and Fiona were extremely helpful and made our stay a real pleasure. All in all, a very nice way to experience and enjoy southern Spain. We recommend La Fonda Barranco highly!
reviews.title: Terrific Experience

likes.liked: — location and assistance of David and Fiona

reviews.text: Great location, 2 minutes from Cathedral and Alcazar. Fiona and David were wonderful hosts recommending restaurants and tourist sights to visit. Breakfast on the roof terrace was excellent and the hotel itself was restored beautifully with excellent bedrooms and bathrooms (with L'Occitane handwash and shower cream). We will definitely stay there again on our next visit to Jerez and recommend it to anyone who wants to avoid large impersonal hotels.
reviews.title: La Fonda Barranco - A civilized haven

reviews.text: My stay at La Fonda Barranco was absolutely blissful. Went for a weekend with a couple of friends and it was the perfect combination of total relaxation and hilarious nights out. The owner offered an amazingly intuitive service whereby he could sense what we wanted before we did and it would suddenly appear - from ordering taxis and suggesting places to eat to appearing with chilled cava on the roof terrace - and, most importantly, he also knew when to slink off so was never an intrusion.
reviews.title: The pefect weekend away

likes.liked: — Location, air conditioning, breakfast on roof terrace

reviews.text: The hotel is a beautiful renovation and has been done with a lot of passion for the history and attention to detail.
reviews.title: I will definitely return to La Fonda Barranco

reviews.text: Would definitely recommend. I've been to Spain many times and it is definitely up there with one of the best places I've stayed.
reviews.title: Great place, great hosts

description: Intimate, stylish, charming best describes this restored merchants house in the historic centre. Breakfast served on roof terrace in summer.
